intro: Chersodoma helianthemoides, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble those of the sunflower. The plant has delicate, fern-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and easy care requirements. Chersodoma helianthemoides is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
